[align=center][img]https://img199.imageshack.us/img199/2368/f1logoh.png[/img] [font=Impact][color=darkorange]ALL FORMULA 1 2011 STUFF GOES HERE[/SIZE][/font] [font=Impact][color=darkorange][url='https://www.formula1.com/live_timing/live_timing.html']+++LIVE TIMING+++[/url] [url='https://mclaren.com/home']+++McLaren's Live Coverage+++[/url][/SIZE][/font]
[align=center][font=Impact]POSSIBLE SPOILERS BELOW![/SIZE][/font][/align]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][b][color=sandybrown]2010 F1 Championship standings: [/SIZE][/b][/font][/align]
[align=center][color=palegreen]1. [b]Red Bull Racing-Renault[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]255 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Mark Webber(AUS)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]94 [/b] :: [b]Sebastian Vettel(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]161 [/b]
2.[b] McLaren-Mercedes[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]186 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Jenson Button(GBR)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]101 [/b] :: [b]Lewis Hamilton(GBR)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]85 [/b]
3. [b]Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]101[/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Fernando Alonso(FAG)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]69[/b] :: [b]Felipe Massa(BRA)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]32 [/b]
4. [b]Renault[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]60[/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Nick Heidfeld(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]29[/b] :: [b]Vitaly Petrov(RUS)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]31[/b]
5. [b]Mercedes GP[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]52[/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Michael Schumacher(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]26[/b] :: [b]Nico Rosberg(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]26 [/b]
6. [b]Sauber-Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]27 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Kamui Kobayashi(JAP)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]25[/b] :: [b]Sergio Perez(MEX)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]2[/b]
7. [b]Scuderia Toro Rosso-Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]12 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Sebastien Buemi(CHE)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]8[/b] :: [b]Jaime Alguersuari(SPA)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]4[/b]
8. [b]Force India-Mercedes[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]10 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Adrian Sutil(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]8[/b] :: [b]Paul di Resta(GBR)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]2 [/b]
9. [b]Williams-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]4[/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Rubens Barrichello(BRA)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]4[/b] :: [b]Pastor Maldonado(VEN)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0[/b]
10. [b]Lotus-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Heikki Kovalainen(FIN)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0[/b] :: [b]Jarno Trulli(ITA)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0 [/b]
11. [b]Virgin-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0[/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Timo Glock(GER)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0[/b] :: [b]Jerome d'Ambrosio(BEL)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0 [/b]
12. [b]HRT-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0 [/b] [color=lemonchiffon][b]Vitantonio Liuzzi(ITA)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0[/b] :: [b]Narain Karthikeyan(IND)[/b] - [b][COLOR=firebrick1]0 [/b] [/align]

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: andx0r
item.description:
It’s good that Bernie finally recognized that some changes would need to made to keep F1 from getting any more boring than it was.

It’s probably been a good decade and change since I really really cared about Formula One racing.

item.source: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

It’s nice how, once they finally got all of their modifications in place, the other teams were actually competitive, but the Red Bull is still probably the best car, and Vettel is obviously the best this year at least.

Adrian Newey. Plus insane reliability this year.

BahamutBBob:

Did the FIA give any reason for the points increase? Or did they just think bigger numbers would be better?

Bigger gap between 1st and 2nd, more racers get points - an impetus of sorts + a response to a larger grid (3 new teams).
Before, you would quite comfortable with finishing 2nd. Now you aren’t.

https://www.fia.com/en-GB/mediacentre/pressreleases/f1releases/2010/Pages/f1_comm_0210.aspx

2010 FIA Formula One World Championship

  • Points system

In order to further encourage the ‘race to win’, an adjustment to the points system was agreed. Points for both titles will be awarded at each event according to the following scale:

1st : 25 points
2nd : 18 points
3rd : 15 points
4th : 12 points
5th : 10 points
6th : 8 points
7th : 6 points
8th : 4 points
9th : 2 points
10th : 1 point

Read full topic
item.source: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
It’s nice how, once they finally got all of their modifications in place, the other teams were actually competitive, but the Red Bull is still probably the best car, and Vettel is obviously the best this year at least.

I hope next year is more exciting than “oh hey Vettel won again” almost every race.

Looking at the link you posted, looks like Schumacher did pretty much the same thing Vettel is doing this year. Only better. Points are a lot closer, though. Did the FIA give any reason for the points increase? Or did they just think bigger numbers would be better?

Read full topic
item.source: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

This being my first F1 season, is it common for the championship winner to dominate like Vettel has? Or are the points usually closer?

Well, Schumi dominated in a similar vein, but…
Last year was way closer. Or take a look at 2004 for example: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004_Formula_One_season#Drivers

Or even twenty-o-fucking-seven: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007_Formula_One_season#Drivers
Kimi was accccceeee

Plus the fact that there used to be 10 points given for 1st place instead of 25 until 2010.

That Red Bull is just too good… or all the others are just too bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
As you may already know…

Oh well. At least Button delayed his party till October. 1 fucking point.
I will be doing write-ups again since Suzuka. So hang in there.

P.S. Boy will I laugh if Button snatches the WDC in Abu Dhabi. May as well place a bet, just for shits and giggles.

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

It’s no problem, thanks for trying.

I just found out the other day that the webspace that comes with my ISP account doesn’t really have a limit. It says 50MB, but that’s only 50MB when every user is using it. Only about 5% of users use it so I should be able to chuck the files up just fine.

Which races did you want?

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Germany was truly excellent!

Hamilton had an excellent drive, when his driving style pays off it silences all his critics. Shame about Button, but also about Paul Di Resta, spun out by Heidfeld (I think). For his first season, he’s driving the wheels off that Force India

item.title: Formula 1 2011. Red Bull vs McLaren Epic.
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Great race, lots of overtaking, the new tires played a large role and I was happy with the podium. Webber 1st would’ve been nice, but Hamilton and Alonso drove beautifully.

Bring on the weekend!

BahamutBBob:

If you could that would be great.

I tried to upload it on a few sites, but they would only allow paying members to download or would say the files is too big =[

Read full topic
